```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(magrittr)
library(jtools)
library(extrafont)
library(ggplot2)
library(lubridate)
library(plotly)
library(tidycensus)
library(tsibble)
library(slider)

extrafont::font_import("./IBM-Plex-Sans", prompt = FALSE)

states <- read_csv("http://covidtracking.com/api/states/daily.csv") %>%
  mutate(
    date = lubridate::as_date(as.character(date))
  ) %>%
  bind_rows(mutate(read_csv("https://covidtracking.com/api/v1/states/current.csv"), date = lubridate::today())) %>%
  # filter(state %in% c("NY", "CO", "FL", "MA", "MN", "CA", "VA", "PA")) %>%
  arrange(state, date) %>%
  group_by(state) %>%
  filter(date != lag(date)) %>%
  mutate(
    new_positives = positive - lag(positive),
    tests = positive + negative,
    icu = inIcuCurrently,
    hospital = hospitalizedCurrently,
    deaths = death,
    new_tests = tests - lag(tests),
    new_hospital = hospital - lag(hospital),
    new_hospital2 = hospitalizedCurrently - lag(hospitalizedCurrently),
    new_deaths = death - lag(death),
    new_icu = icu - lag(icu),
    new_icu2 = inIcuCumulative - lag(inIcuCumulative),
    new_icu = case_when(
      is.na(icu) & !is.na(onVentilatorCurrently) ~ onVentilatorCurrently - lag(onVentilatorCurrently),
      TRUE ~ new_icu
    ),
    new_icu2 = case_when(
      is.na(inIcuCumulative) & !is.na(onVentilatorCumulative) ~ onVentilatorCumulative - lag(onVentilatorCumulative),
      TRUE ~ new_icu2
    ),
    pos_rate = new_positives/new_tests,
  )

sc <- filter(states, state == "SC")
sc$new_deaths[sc$date > as.Date("2020-03-05") & sc$date < as.Date("2020-03-17")] <- 0
sc$reporting_backlog <- FALSE
sc$reporting_backlog[sc$date < as.Date("2020-05-01") & sc$new_deaths > 40] <- TRUE

dhec_dat <- read_csv("scdhec_test_data.csv",
                     col_names = c("date", "rep_pos_rate"),
                     col_types = cols(date = col_date("%m/%d/%Y"),
                                      rep_pos_rate = col_double()),
                     skip = 1) %>%
  mutate(date = date + 1)

sc <- full_join(sc, dhec_dat, by = "date")

dhec_cases <- read_csv("dhec_case_data.csv")

sc <- full_join(sc, dhec_cases, by = "date")

sc %<>%
  ungroup() %>%
  mutate(
    new_positives2 = new_positives,
    new_positives = case_when(
      !is.na(cases) ~ cases,
      TRUE ~ new_positives
    ),
    new_tests = case_when(
      !is.na(rep_pos_rate) ~ new_positives / rep_pos_rate,
      !is.na(rep_pos_rate2) ~ new_positives / rep_pos_rate2,
      TRUE ~ new_tests,
    ),
    total_tests = cumsum(replace_na(new_tests, 0)),
    pos_rate2 = pos_rate,
    pos_rate = case_when(
      !is.na(rep_pos_rate) ~ rep_pos_rate,
      !is.na(rep_pos_rate2) ~ rep_pos_rate2,
      TRUE ~ pos_rate
    ),
    new_deaths = case_when(
      !is.na(deaths2) ~ deaths2,
      dateModified == lag(dateModified) ~ NA_real_,
      TRUE ~ new_deaths
    ),
    day_of_week = factor(wday(date)),
    day_of_week = relevel(day_of_week, ref = "7")
  ) 

two_weeks <- function(x) {
  seq(x[1], x[2], 21)
}

into_date <- function(x) {
  if ("Date" %in% class(x)) {
    format(x, "%b %e")
  } else {
    format(as.Date(x, origin = "1970-01-01"), "%b %e")
  }
}

num_points <- as.numeric(range(filter(states, state == "SC")$date)[2] - 
  range(filter(states, state == "SC")$date)[1])
```

```{r}
ggplot(sc %>%
         pivot_longer(c(new_tests, new_positives), names_to = "test_type") %>%
         mutate(test_type = ifelse(test_type == "new_positives",
                                   yes = "Positives", no = "Total")),
       aes(x = date, y = value, colour = test_type)) +
  geom_smooth(se = F, n = num_points) +
  geom_point(aes(text = paste(
    "Date:", date,
    paste0("\n", ifelse(test_type == "Positives", "Positives:", "Tests:")),
            round(value)
    )
  )) +
  theme_nice(base_family = "IBM Plex Sans") +
  ylab("Number of tests/day") +
  scale_colour_manual(name = NULL, values = c("#49b7fc", "#ff7b00"),
                      breaks = c("Positives", "Total"),
                      labels = c("Positive tests", "Total tests"),
                      guide = NULL) +
  xlab("Date") +
  scale_y_log10(labels = scales::label_number(accuracy = 1, big.mark = ","),
                limits = c(1, 50000)) +
  geom_vline(xintercept = as.numeric(as.Date("2020-05-04")),
             linetype = "dashed", color = "#466A9F") +
  geom_vline(xintercept = as.numeric(as.Date("2020-04-07")),
             linetype = "dashed", color = "#73000a") +
  geom_vline(xintercept = as.numeric(as.Date("2020-03-31")),

  geom_vline(xintercept = as.numeric(as.Date("2020-03-15")),
             linetype = "dashed", color = "#ff6673") +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = two_weeks, labels = into_date) -> tests
```

### Weekly case growth 

```{r include = FALSE}
options(tigris_use_cache = TRUE)

census_api_key(Sys.getenv("CENSUS_API_KEY"))

acs_dat <- get_acs("county", state = "SC", 
                   variables = c(population = "B01003_001"),
                   year = 2018, survey = "acs5",
                   geometry = TRUE, keep_geo_vars = FALSE) %>%
  dplyr::select(fips = GEOID, population = estimate, geometry)
```


```{r}
nytc <- 
  read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nytimes/covid-19-data/master/us-counties.csv") %>%
  filter(state == "South Carolina") %>%
  inner_join(select(as_tibble(acs_dat), -geometry), by = "fips") %>%
  as_tsibble(key = county, index = date) %>%
  group_by_key() %>%
  mutate(
    lag_cases = lag(cases),
    lag_cases = replace_na(lag_cases, 0),
    new_cases = cases - lag_cases,
    lag_deaths = lag(deaths),
    lag_deaths = replace_na(lag_deaths, 0),
    new_deaths = deaths - lag_deaths,
    new_cases_avg = slide_dbl(new_cases, ~mean(.x), .before = 6),
    new_deaths_avg = slide_dbl(new_deaths, ~mean(.x), .before = 6),
    lag_cases_avg = lag(new_cases_avg, 6),
    lag_deaths_avg = lag(new_deaths_avg, 6),
    case_growth = new_cases_avg / lag_cases_avg + 
      # Adding random noise because ggplotly has an error when two fills
      # have exactly the same value and I want to use hoveron = "fill"
      # https://github.com/ropensci/plotly/issues/1641
      rnorm(1, sd = .001),
    death_growth = new_deaths_avg / lag_deaths_avg,
  ) %>%
  filter(date == max(date)) %>%
  mutate(
    cases_per_cap = cases / population,
    # Adding random noise because ggplotly has an error when two fills
    # have exactly the same value and I want to use hoveron = "fill"
    # https://github.com/ropensci/plotly/issues/1641
    deaths_per_cap = deaths / population + abs(rnorm(1, sd = 0.000001)),
    # Adding random noise because ggplotly has an error when two fills
    # have exactly the same value and I want to use hoveron = "fill"
    # https://github.com/ropensci/plotly/issues/1641
    deaths = deaths + rnorm(1, sd = 0.1)
  ) %>%
  as_tibble()

inner_join(acs_dat, nytc, by = "fips") %>%
  ggplot(aes(fill = case_growth,
             text = paste(
               county, "County",
               "\nCase growth =", ifelse(
                 is.finite(case_growth),
                 yes = paste0(round((case_growth - 1) * 100), "%"),
                 no = "No data")
             ))) +
  geom_sf() +
  # geom_point(y = 34.0007100, y = -81.0348100, ) +
  ggthemes::theme_map() +
  # ggtitle("New case growth") +
  scale_fill_gradient2(low = scales::muted("blue"),
                       high = scales::muted("red"), midpoint = 1,
                       limits = c(0.5, 2), oob = scales::squish,
                       breaks = c(0.5, 1, 1.5, 2),
                       labels = c(
                         "Shrinking rapidly",
                         "Staying the same", 
                         "Going up 50% per week", 
                         "Doubling every week"
                       ),
                       name = "New cases are...",
                       guide = "legend"
                      ) -> scmap

ann <- list(
  y = c(34.0007100, 32.784618, 34.852619, 33.689060),
  x = c(-81.0348100, -79.940918, -82.394012, -78.886696),
  xref = "x",
  yref = "y",
  text = c("Columbia", "Charleston", "Greenville", "Myrtle Beach"),
  showarrow = TRUE,
  arrowhead = 6,
  arrowsize = 0.01,
  ax = 10,
  ay = 10,
  bgcolor = "#FFFFFF",
  font = list(
    size = 10,
    color = "#000000",
    family = "IBM Plex Sans"
  )
)

pmap <- ggplotly(scmap, tooltip = "text") %>%
  style(hoveron = "fill") %>%
  style(hoverlabel = label) %>%
  layout(font = font) %>%
  layout(annotations = ann) %>%
  hide_guides()

pmap
```
